feed.title: Xin Yi's Blog
feed.subtitle: A blog for my thoughts, learnings, reflections, and ideas

entry.title: Weeklys #1
entry.summary: Song I have on repeat: Motherlake by JABBERLOOP What I spent my time on: debugging this blog, doodling on paper and on my dirty white Vans, practicing juggling, listening to the audiobook version of Before the Coffee Gets Cold One interesting thing I learnt this week: I am reading a book called Judging Machines [https://static1.squarespace.com/static/5e6bac9e0eedae432b177355/t/60e6369e39941a4...

entry.title: Singapore could use a...
entry.summary: Singapore could use a mountain to escape to when overwhelmed by school/ work/ the city a space for crafting and doing all kinds of visual arts (for adults) that is free and open to anyone to come anytime. Materials can be communally sourced affordable djembe lessons engaging activities to do on the mrt that isn’t just endless scrolling on the phone

entry.title: Questions and goals
entry.summary: I had a list of topics/questions I wanted to write blog posts about. But nowadays, it is just so straightfoward to get a good explanation of most concepts from ChatGPT that I really don’t see the point in writing those posts anymore. I feel like the most efficient way to “write” them would just be to type in questions to ChatGPT and make a few edits. There is just not much point in doing that. ...

entry.title: CUDA
entry.summary: I have stumbled upon CUDA in the past when running ML stuff on colab “cuda.is_available()” but I until now, I haven’t stopped to question what CUDA is. But while reading about Python’s Global Interpreter Lock, I stumbled upon it. This statement got me a bit more interested to know what CUDA is about: “[…] creating a DataLoader after accessing a GPU can lead to confusing CUDA errors. Accessing ...

entry.title: Maturity
entry.summary: Yesterday a friend asked me what I consider maturity to be. It got me thinking. Recently I have been thinking more about my transition to adulthood, but in a more “what new habits should I pick up?”, “what new responsibilities should I take on”, “how should I find a balance between work and life, work and doing things I really feel for” kind of way. Is that all the transition to adulthood enta...
